intro: Eschscholzia ramosa var. trichophylla, commonly known as the Trichophylla poppy, is a flowering plant native to California. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and delicate, yellowish-orange flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine, hairy textures, which give it its varietal name "trichophylla." This species is part of the Papaveraceae family, known for its showy blooms and medicinal properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
